DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Postoperative Fever Complication Duration
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the numeric value measuring the length of time in day during which elevated body temperature was reported following an operative procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the postoperative elevation of the body's temperature above the upper limit of normal, usually taken as 37.7 degrees C, as a complication for a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: After surgery.:Fever, also known as pyrexia, is the elevation of the body's temperature above the upper limit of normal, usually taken as 37.7 degrees C.  Most fevers are caused by infections and almost all infectious diseases cause fever. (Wikipedia):Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.
Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number of days during which an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The period of time during which something continues.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: No change, trying to fix issue in CDE Browser where details page won't open for the associated CDE. - DW 8-17-2017

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
